items.title: Software Engineer (Full Stack)
items.content:
About you

If you care about software quality but find testing and QA boring and tedious, you may be interested in helping us develop a new way.
Do you love building new stuff, learning and working with emerging technologies? Working with a team of skilled engineers with the same passion as yours and a desire to build unique and groundbreaking products?
If so, we would like to hear from you.


About us

We are SpotQA's Product Team, we're building the next generation of test automation software.
We are building the self-driving car technology for the testing world.
Our objective? To develop new technology that uses machine-learning and domain expertise with the aim of performing testing fully autonomously
To help with our mission, we are looking for a passionate Senior Software Engineer / Full-stack developer, to join our core engineering team.


REQUIREMENTS

Since we're building emerging technology, we're looking for solid engineering skills and experience. But more importantly, we are looking for can-do attitudes, a passion to learn/grow independently and willingness to delve into problems.

Ideally, we're looking for a wide variety of skills and experience, but don't be put off if you don't consider yourself an expert in every single one of these areas. If you see yourself here and share our passions, we'd still love to hear from you!

We have our eyes on a few skills, namely expertise/strong experience in the following:

Strong Java engineering skills
Linux based environments and bash scripting
Container technology (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
VCS (e.g., Git, Mercurial) and CI (e.g., Jenkins, TravisCI, CircleCI)
Deep understanding of algorithms and data structure:
Time / complexity trade-offs of data structures, and ability to implement Trees, Graphs, and D&C algorithms
Garbage collection technology, performance tuning techniques, memory leaks, etc.
Software design patterns and passion for writing clean code
Good communication skills and ability to liaise with other teams
Building REST interfaces, use of Web-sockets
Strong JavaScript skills, along with HTML5/CSS3
Build systems (e.g., Maven, Gradle, Bazel)
Relational & NoSQL DBs (e.g., PostgresSQL, MySQL, MongoDB), and in-memory stores (e.g., Redis, Hazelcast)
Testing frameworks (e.g., JUnit, Jest)
++ Bonus Points ++

Relevant degree in computer science / software engineering
ES6 and Node.js
Vue.js or React.js, as well as Flux-based architectures (e.g., VueX or Redux)
Building web crawlers, and utilising browser automation interfaces, e.g., Selenium, Chrome Remote Debugging

items.title: Learning Tapestry: QA Lead Engineer - Nearshore - Remote
items.content:
QA Lead Engineer - Nearshore - Remote

Posted Oct 26

Learning Tapestry
Headquarters: Berkeley, CA
https://jobs.enlist.io/learning_tapestry/jobs/7e96e9c0-f7b1-449c-bfa8-6bf774f368b3

About Learning Tapestry

Hi! We're Learning Tapestry. We're a 35+ person all-remote, global organization dedicated to making digital learning "just work" for educators and learners alike. We solve hard problems in complex education technology environments. We’re a triple bottom line company: we make a profit like any good business; our work makes the world better (“social impact”); and we create a healthy internal work environment for everyone who works here. For our staff we believe in flexible work locations and working arrangements. We empower all of our team members to manage their schedules and adjust as necessary. We're focused on results and impact, not locations and hours. We hire people with great technical ability, but we also expect everyone at Learning Tapestry to have a strong character and solid communication skills.

What We're Looking For

Our client list is growing quickly, so we're looking for a Quality Assurance Lead Engineer to help us deliver exceptional solutions for our clients, and to help us build a strong QA practice (and team, in the near future). The position is full-time and remote. To minimize timezone challenges, you should be available for working for at least 4 hours of your time every day with US/Eastern time zone business hours (8am - 6pm).

About You

  • You’ve got 5+ years as a QA engineer/analyst with increasing levels of responsibility throughout your career. You’ve worked on a wide variety of projects, from new development to taking over maintenance of an existing test suite.
  • You’re comfortable in a remote work environment, with team members from different time zones. You can manage your own time and are a self-starter.
  • You are experienced and fluent in the productivity tools we use, like Google Apps & Hangouts, Slack, and Harvest for time tracking.
  • You’re comfortable hiring, leading and managing a team of QA engineers. We have a couple of contracted QA people on staff now, and that could grow.
  • You have experience developing and writing test plans for large software development initiatives, and working with clients to verify signoff of delivered functionality.
  • You’ve got demonstrable experience developing new tests and maintaining test suites in Ruby (with rspec, minitest, capybara, or similar), mobile (iOS, Android or React Native), javascript (mocha, chai, jest, etc) or .NET. In an ideal case you’ve got experience with more than one of these.
  • You’ve developed and executed cross-browser testing, using Browserstack, Sauce Labs, or similar.
  • You’re comfortable with git for version control, and have used Github for reviewing pull requests.

Bonus Skills

  • You’re an especially strong candidate if you have experience writing tests for automated test frameworks like Selenium or appium, and integrating a test suite with Continuous Integration tools, and software development lifecycles using Github or Bitbucket.
  • You’ve used several issue trackers in your career, like Github issues, Asana, Jira, or Redmine and you have strong opinions about which you prefer, and why.

Please do not hesitate to apply if you do not match these requirements exactly but think you could be a good fit.

Equal Opportunity

Learning Tapestry is an equal opportunity employer and encourages individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds, sexual orientations, and gender identities to apply. We are also particularly interested in individuals who have lived in or worked with underserved communities such as low-income, gender nonconforming, disabled, or indigenous peoples.

Apply for this position

Fill out the online application here: https://jobs.enlist.io/learning_tapestry/jobs/7e96e9c0-f7b1-449c-bfa8-6bf774f368b3

items.title: Senior Software Engineer @ Sprinklr
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer @ Sprinklr

2017-10-23 03:15

Description

Who We Are

Sprinklr is 1,300 employees strong, valued at $1.8 billion, and one of the fastest growing companies in the history of enterprise software.

In the age of the empowered and connected customer, we know that every experience a customer has with a brand matters...a lot.

That’s why -- from the very beginning -- Sprinklr set out to build a powerful, agnostic, and first-of-its-kind “social operating system” that integrates with an organization’s existing tech infrastructure and allows employees across the front office to collaborate more effectively and deliver superior customer experiences across every social channel.

Today, we’re revolutionizing customer engagement in 75+ countries for more than 1000 of the most recognized brands, including Nike, JPMorgan Chase, Verizon, McDonald’s, Microsoft, P&G, Uber, and more than 50% of the Fortune 50.

We’ve spent the last six years building the world’s most complete enterprise social technology. Now we’re leveraging that market-leading position to help the biggest brands on the planet take on one of the largest opportunities ever in enterprise software: unifying the front office.

And we’re bringing the very best talent in the world together to get there.

What You'll Do

We are currently seeking a person with extensive development and consulting experience. Full-stack software engineers with experience in a wide variety of technologies are preferred. It is imperative that you not only know your way around various front-end and back-end architectures, but can also walk a technical or non-technical customer through the process of integrating two business systems.

In this role you will be leading customer integration activities as well as rolling up your sleeves when it’s needed.

What Are Your Responsibilities

  • Consult with internal and external customers in a highly complex technical environment
  • Provide solutions using creative problem solving, technical expertise and strong understanding of underlying business requirements and best practices.
  • Write proof-of-concept applications using available SDKs and APIs
  • Research, design and implement solutions to highly ambiguous problems
  • Provided guidance to customers who are implementing solutions using the Sprinklr API.
  • Analyze API source code and assist product and documentation teams identifying gaps in the documentation.
  • Maintain knowledge of the Sprinklr application and architecture.
  • Work closely with the Product Support, Customer Success, Client Services and Development teams to resolve application issues and plan for changes, upgrades, enhancements and new customer provisioning.
  • Document operational procedures
  • Inspire, grow and lead junior consultants
  • Follow industry trends and developments to provide new ideas and recommendations on processes and products.

Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified

  • Minimum of 6+ years of experience building scalable web based applications
  • Minimum of 3 years experience developing backend systems in Java
  • Solid understanding of web application security and vulnerabilities (such as the OWASP top 10 list).
  • Experience designing and consuming REST based API services.
  • Proficient in HTML, JavaScript (ES6), and/or CSS.
  • Familiar with source control management systems (git is preferred).
  • Experience with NoSql databases such as MongoDB and ElasticSearch
  • Experience with Message Queuing Systems such as Kafka
  • Experience with Javascript Frameworks such as Express, React, Redux
  • Experience with Spring, Spring Boot and Spring Cloud
  • Experience with Docker, AWS, Azure and deployment strategies
  • Comfortable working in a UNIX environment.
  • Experience with Social Media and CRM Integrations

While our strong preference is for this position to be in Austin TX, we recognize that great talent can be found all over and will consider remote work candidates from anywhere in the U.S.

You know You're Successful if….

You’re just as comfortable writing code as you are having a conversation with someone about writing code. The right person for this job will have extensive development experience but have more to offer than your average software engineer.

If you habitually analyze business processes and find yourself designing databases and writing APIs in your mind in order to make sense of a process you might be exactly the person we’re looking for.

Country

United States

items.title: Developer Evangelist @ Wallaroo Labs
items.content:
Developer Evangelist @ Wallaroo Labs

2017-10-23 03:06

Description

Wallaroo Labs is working on a huge idea, and this is a phenomenal opportunity for a person who enjoys challenges. We believe in open source and strive to build on these technologies. Our distributed team is ten people and growing. We had have generated a lot of interest through our product and vision and raised a large seed round with several well-known VCs.

Faster data, more data sources, and business requirements are driving increasingly sophisticated algorithms and putting more and more demands on data applications. Wallaroo Labs solves these problems with Wallaroo, a data engine for building highly elastic big data applications.

We are looking for a Developer Evangelist to drive the adoption of Wallaroo open-source offering within the developer community. This position is essential to our success; you will be responsible for identifying friction points with Wallaroo and systematically eliminate to improve the developer experience.

Although Wallaroo's headquarters is in New York, this position can be remote. Candidates located in a Tech Hub cities or that have deep connections within existing developer networks would prove invaluable in building our community.

Responsibilities

  • Monitor communication channels (HN, Reddit, StackOverflow, Mailing lists, IRC) and interact with the community, answer questions and assist developers.
  • Identify and build relationships with the developer community, meetups, and conferences and leverage relationships to evangelize Wallaroo.
  • Own problem resolution and participate with the development team to create solutions.
  • Publish content from blog posts to video demos.

Qualities we are looking for

  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly.
  • Comfortable with a variety of programming languages, experience with Python, Go, JavaScript are a plus.
  • Familiar with Big Data technologies.
  • Desire and ability to work with enterprise clients and our open source community.
  • Experience working with open source software, GitHub etc.
  • Familiar with software development process in a business setting.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.

Learn more about Wallaroo

  • Corporate site: http://www.wallaroolabs.com
  • Wallaroo Community Site: http://www.wallaroolabs.com/community
  • Wallaroo Blog: https://blog.wallaroolabs.com/
  • GitHub: https://github.com/WallarooLabs/wallaroo

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: ServiceNow Developer - Information Techology Coalition, Inc. - Remote
items.content:
ServiceNow Developer
Information Techology Coalition, Inc. -Remote
– Job Description
ITC has an opportunity for a dynamic ServiceNow Developer to support the Department of Commerce Headquarters (DOC HQ) as a sub to CSRA. The primary work location will be remote, with travel for periods of time to CSRA’s office Arlington, VA with frequent travel to DOC HQ in Washington, DC. CSRA is pursuing an opportunity at this customer that will support the creation of a DOC-wide shared services infrastructure (SSI). This role requires a dynamic contributor who can manage and configure ServiceNow applications and modules, develop new products, and perform some system administration tasks. This is a greenfield environment so candidates need to understand all aspects of the product and be experienced in implementing all modules. The role will require good customer-facing skills and outstanding written and verbal communication. In addition, the ServiceNow Developer will need to be collaborative and work closely with business analysis, testing, and support teams in implementing, testing, and supporting the solution.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with stakeholders, business analysts, and UX analysts in interpreting requirements into ServiceNow. This will include prototyping solutions in ServiceNow. Contribute to the strategic development of new platform customizations, as needed, based on customer needs Participate in the collection and implementation of tool requirements and investigate, as necessary, to determine the best solution or configuration options available based on the specific requirement Develop detailed designs for the implementation of new products and capabilities built on ServiceNow as well as for the integration with downstream systems Participate in the design and development of a single sign-on security solution Engage in a full agile development process including detailed design, development, unit testing, and configuration management Identify, diagnose, research, track, and resolve technical issues within the platform & user work flows. Manages accounts/groups and their memberships within ServiceNow Provides assistance with report configuration and maintenance, as needed Performs operational administrative tasks, as needed Actively collaborates with other teammates to perform code reviews and discuss new developments and projects Produce all required deliverables

Requirements:
Qualifications:
Years of Experience: 8 years of IT experience with at least 3 years of direct ServiceNow experienceRequired Education: Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, or equivalent; Master’s degree preferredRequired Certification: ServiceNow Certified System AdministratorDesired Certification: ServiceNow Certified Application Developer, Certified Implementation SpecialistExpert in understanding and developing on the core ServiceNow platform, including administration, support, break/fix and API’s.Experienced in developing user friendly catalog items with experience writing orchestration workflows such as Content Management, LDAP, Web Services, Active Directory and Custom ActivitiesMust understand best practices and proper implementations of the ServiceNow platform.Must demonstrate analytical and initiative taking abilities, while being self-motivated with a strong customer focus.Experienced with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS; Java/JEE experience highly preferredAbility to work and deliver high quality services in a demanding environment under aggressive deadlinesExperienced working in an Agile lifecycleOutstanding written and verbal communication skillsPermanent Residency or US Citizenship RequiredMust be eligible for a Public Trust Clearance

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Location: Flexible (Boston preferred)


For candidates interested in working remotely, you bring demonstrated experience and previous success working remotely


Position is available: August 2017


THE OPPORTUNITY


Now that ANet is more than ten years old, the Engineering Team is redesigning many of our existing Java-based software systems. We started with our content creation platform, which is used to design student assessments. We recently went into production with a new stack of Go-based microservices. We are now working on revamping the system that delivers this content to students, as well as reporting the results.


Reporting to the Director of Engineering, this Senior Software Engineer will play a key role in crafting and implementing our technology vision for the organization.  The ideal candidate will be passionate about cutting-edge development and best practices and able to work across the stack. We are looking for a flexible and adaptable engineer with some of the following skills and/or enthusiasm for learning and growing in these areas:



  • Server-side development using Java and/or Go programming languages to build scalable, RESTful web services.

  • Data-focused engineering in both SQL and NoSQL (Mongo) environments.

  • Maintain and improve existing Data warehouse and ETL processes.

  • Design, promote, and implement data infrastructures that adhere to responsible data management principles.

  • Design and implement sustainable DevOps using AWS.


ANet is flexible to remote working with appropriate experience and a history of successfully mentoring other developers remotely. Occasional travel to ANet’s National Office in Boston will be necessary, so proximity to the New England area and eastern time zone is preferable.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Play a leadership role in designing, implementing and deploying sustainable code for substantial features and systems.

  • Implement ANet’s next generation of technology products that support data-driven educational practices and help to close the achievement gap in the underserved communities we partner with.

  • Create, monitor and deliver against the product road map and corresponding release cycles (as negotiated with the Product Management Team).

  • Provide strategic leadership in setting goals and measuring progress in RESTful server-side APIs and/or agile, componentized client-side code.

  • Help manage, improve, and automate our deployment frameworks.

  • Keep abreast of new technologies and propose adoption as appropriate.

  • Mentor and support the development of junior developers as appropriate.

  • Actively embrace and model best practices such as code reviews, unit testing, and planning/scoping/vetting larger features.

  • Proactively look for ways to build our team through individual contributions which help us improve code quality, team culture, and team velocity.


WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU BRING


In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following:



  • You have direct experience in many of the following:




    • Java and/or Go programming language

    • Scrum or other Agile development processes

    • RESTful Web Services

    • Cloud-based data services, preferably with both SQL and NoSQL implementations

    • Cloud-based infrastructure on AWS, including continuous integration and deployment




  • You are a team player who motivates and educates colleagues; you enjoy working in a highly collaborative and agile culture.

  • You are skilled in working closely with business partners to build technology solutions that meet the usability and functional needs of both internal and external users.

  • You operate comfortably among a highly independent staff with diverse backgrounds.

  • You bring an innovative approach to analyze, evaluate and solve problems.

  • You have a passionate commitment to and a sense of urgency for the support of schools, along with a belief that all students can achieve at high levels.

  • You are motivated by working in an environment where we live out our core values daily and are eager to examine personal archetypes and biases while discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege which relate to ANet’s Advance Equity and People Matter values.


Preferred Qualifications:



  • 4+ years of software development experience

  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related degree



ANet is committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds and gender identities to apply to our positions.
